intro: Adesmia darapskyana, commonly known as the pink burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets. Adesmia darapskyana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
